discussion.content:
D
 punchdown tool is most commonly used on a patch panel to terminate twisted pair cables, such as Ethernet cables. It is not typically used on cable modems, managed switches, or PoE injectors.

questions.question_text: Which of the following devices would a punchdown tool MOST likely be utilized on?

discussion.content: Correct. Use native M.2 slots or PCIe adapter card

Selected Answer: BC
NVMe drives use M.2 and PCIe interfaces. PCIe is dedicated to external drives.

comments.content:
PCIe is NOT dedicated to external drives.
PCIe has many purposes internally and also with things besides drives, such as GPU, network cards, sound cards, capture cards, etc.
It actually looks like NVMe uses it's own type of PCIe interface since it's SSD I guess.
It is confusing though since it says he's looking for "hard drives"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
M.2 and PCIe adapter card

Selected Answer: BC
M.2 is the physical slot that the NVMe drive goes inside. PCIe is the communication protocol. If the motherboard has an M.2 slot and supports PCIe, the NVMe drive will be accommodated on the motherboard.

Selected Answer: BC
M.2 Slot (Option B):
NVMe drives typically use the M.2 form factor.
Check if your PC motherboard has an available M.2 slot. Look for an M.2 connector on the motherboard labeled for NVMe or PCIe SSDs.
PCIe Support (Option C):
NVMe drives connect via the PCIe (Peripheral Component Interconnect Express) interface.
Ensure that your PC supports PCIe (usually through the motherboard chipset) to take advantage of NVMe speeds.

Selected Answer: BC
B. M.2 Most Voted
C. PCIe. Most Voted

Selected Answer: C
NVMe (NVM Express™, or Non-Volatile Memory Express) is a communication protocol designed specifically to work with flash memory using the PCIe interface.

Selected Answer: BC
Correct. And is also used on laptops that does not have sata installed.

Selected Answer: BC
B. M.2
C. PCIe

The user should confirm that the PC has an M.2 or PCIe slot available, as NVMe drives use these interfaces to connect to the motherboard. SATA and SAS are older interfaces and will not work with NVMe drives. SCSI is a different type of interface and is not commonly used with consumer PCs. DRAM is a type of memory and not a drive interface.

Selected Answer: B
It has 2 be B. PCIe is to vague and you also need a PCIe ADAPTER you cannot just plug the drive into the slot.

Selected Answer: BC
is b and c in case you don't have M.2 get an pcie to m2 adapter

questions.question_text:
A user is researching hard drives to upgrade a PC and has decided to purchase a NVMe drive. Which of the following should the user confirm are available on the
PC before making the purchase? (Choose two.)

A user reports a tablet restarts on its own every five to ten minutes. In addition, the tablet has intermittent issues with charging. The technician gives the user a new power adapter and charging cable, and the technician also tries resetting the OS, but the issue persists. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the issue?

discussion.content:
C
A faulty battery could cause a tablet to restart on its own and have intermittent issues with charging. Water damage could also cause these symptoms, but it is not the most likely cause unless there is evidence of liquid exposure. Incorrect OS version could cause compatibility or performance issues, but not charging
problems. Damaged charging port could prevent the tablet from charging, but not cause it to restart randomly.

The most likely cause of the issue is C. Faulty battery.

A faulty battery can cause a variety of issues, including unexpected shutdowns, reboots, and charging problems. If the battery is not charging properly or is damaged, it can trigger these symptoms.

Here's why the other options are less likely:

A. Water damage: Water damage would typically cause more severe issues, such as a completely unresponsive device or a damaged screen.
B. Incorrect OS version: An incorrect OS version might cause software compatibility issues or performance problems, but it's less likely to cause frequent reboots.
D. Damaged charging port: A damaged charging port could prevent the device from charging, but it wouldn't necessarily cause frequent reboots.
Therefore, replacing the faulty battery is the most likely solution to resolve the issue.

GG
Answer is C. The clue here is that it keeps restarting on its own, which has nothing to do with the charging port. faulty battery

Selected Answer: C
C is correct, if the answer was D the phone would not charge
I think D is correct

questions.question_text: A technician verifies the slow boot time and slow OS performance of a tower server with a RAID 5 on a PCIe RAID card that does not support hot swapping. Which of the following steps should the technician take NEXT to verify RAID health?

comments.content: You can have both enabled, SMART will give you health info on the individual drives and RAID controller is for the RAID array. Having both enabled is guaranteed to give you problems.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The wiki (http://doc.freenas.org/index.php/S.M.A.R.T._Tests) states:

to prevent problems, do not enable the S.M.A.R.T. service if your disks are controlled by a RAID controller as it is the job of the controller to monitor S.M.A.R.T. and mark drives as Predictive Failure when they trip.

D
Since the RAID card does not support hot swapping, the technician needs to shut down the server and check the RAID controller’s status to verify RAID health. S.M.A.R.T. is a feature of hard drives, not RAID cards. Replacing the failed drive while users are connected could cause data loss or corruption. Physically cleaning the HDDs and connectors is unlikely to solve the slow boot time and performance issues

choices.A: Verify S.M.A.R.T. operation on the RAID card.
choices.C: Physically clean the HDDs and connectors.
choices.D: Shut down the server and check the RAID controller's status.
choices.B: Replace the failed drive while users are connected.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Ensure the input connections to the screen are secure.

The recent movement of the flight information screens during the terminal gates remodeling could have caused issues with the input connections. Ensuring that the input connections are secure is a logical first step in troubleshooting the problem. If the connections are loose or not properly connected, it could lead to display issues. After securing the connections, the technician can further investigate if the problem persists.

Selected Answer: A
A. Ensure the input connections to the screen are secure.

questions.question_text: A field technician for an airport receives a support ticket that states customers are having issues viewing a screen that displays information about departing flights. While checking the case history, the technician sees that all fight information screens were recently moved when the terminal gates were remodeled. Which of the following actions should the technician perform after verifying the screen has power?

choices.C: Check to see if the device outputting the data is turned on.
choices.B: Swap cables with a screen that works.
choices.D: Determine if the screen is compatible with the output device.
choices.A: Ensure the input connections to the screen are secure.
